statements.name: PROC SPC
statements.description: The SPC procedure performs Shewhart control chart analysis in SAS Viya. † The Shewhart control chart is a graphical and analytical tool for deciding whether a process is in a state of statistical control. You can use the SPC procedure to compute many different types of control charts, including all commonly used charts for variables and attributes.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the input data table that contains process information for PROC SPC to analyze. CAS-libref specifies the CAS library where the input data table resides, and data-table specifies the name of the input data table.

arguments.name: LIMITS=
arguments.description: Names an input data table that contains preestablished control limits or the parameters from which control limits can be computed.

arguments.name: NTHREADS=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of threads per node to be used to perform the analysis. You can specify a number between 1 and 64, inclusive. By default, n is the maximum number of threads available on each node.

arguments.name: PROCESSNAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains the names of processes to be analyzed.

arguments.name: PROCESSVALUE=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains process measurements to be analyzed. By default, PROC SPC looks for a variable named process that contains the process measurements.

arguments.name: SUBGROUPNAME=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains the names of subgroup variables.

arguments.name: SUBGROUPVALUE=
arguments.description: Specifies the variable in the input data table that contains subgroup values. Subgroup values identify rational subgroups for control chart analysis. By default, PROC SPC looks for a variable named subgroup that contains the subgroup values.

statements.name: BOXCHART
statements.description: The BOXCHART statement computes control charts for subgroup means or medians, along with statistics that describe the distribution of data within each subgroup.

arguments.name: ALLN
arguments.description: Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_.

arguments.name: CONTROLSTAT=
arguments.description: Specifies whether the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means or for subgroup medians.

arguments.name: MEAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup means.

arguments.name: MEDIAN
arguments.description: Specifies that the control limits displayed in a box chart are to be computed for subgroup medians.

arguments.name: EXCHART
arguments.description: Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= option are positive.

arguments.name: LIMITN=
arguments.description: Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits.

arguments.name: MEDCENTRAL=
arguments.description: Identifies a method for estimating the process mean, µ, which is represented by the central line on a median chart.

arguments.name: AVGMEAN
arguments.description: Average of subgroup means

arguments.name: AVGMED
arguments.description: Average of subgroup medians

arguments.name: MEDMED
arguments.description: Median of subgroup medians

arguments.name: NO3SIGMACHECK
arguments.description: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of ODS output.

arguments.name: OUTLIMITS=
arguments.description: Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

arguments.name: OUTTABLE=
arguments.description: Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

arguments.name: PCTLDEF=
arguments.description: Specifies one of five definitions used to calculate percentiles in the construction of box-and-whiskers plots requested with the BOXCHART statement.
Definition 1 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 2 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 3 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 4 for computing quantile statistics
Definition 5 for computing quantile statistics

arguments.name: SIGMAS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

arguments.name: SMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.
arguments.help: SMETHOD=MAD | MMR | MVGRANGE | RMSDF | RMVLUE | RNOWEIGHT | SMVLUE | SNOWEIGHT

arguments.name: MAD
arguments.description: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ.

arguments.name: MMR
arguments.description: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ.

arguments.name: MVGRANGE
arguments.description: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means.

arguments.name: RMSDF
arguments.description: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ.

arguments.name: RMVLUE
arguments.description: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup ranges.

arguments.name: RNOWEIGHT
arguments.description: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup ranges.

arguments.name: SMVLUE
arguments.description: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: SNOWEIGHT
arguments.description: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: TEST2RUN=
arguments.description: TEST2RUN=run-length
7 in a row
8 in a row
9 in a row
At least 10 out of 11 in a row
At least 12 out of 14 in a row
At least 16 out of 20 in a row

arguments.name: TEST3RUN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.
Length of the pattern is at least 6.
Length of the pattern is at least 7.
Length of the pattern is at least 8.

arguments.name: TESTNSTD
arguments.description: applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardized test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

arguments.name: TESTOVERLAP
arguments.description: Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

arguments.name: TESTS=
arguments.description: Requests one or more tests for special causes, which are also known as runs tests, pattern tests, and Western Electric rules.
One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
Six points in a row steadily increasing
Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C

statements.name: BY
statements.description: You can specify a BY statement in PROC SPC to obtain separate analyses of observations in groups that are defined by the values of the BY variables. If you specify more than one BY statement, only the last one specified is used.

statements.name: CCHART
statements.description: The CCHART statement computes c charts for the numbers of nonconformities (defects) in subgroup samples.

arguments.name: ALLN
arguments.description: Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_.

arguments.name: EXCHART
arguments.description: Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= option are positive.

arguments.name: LIMITN=
arguments.description: Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits.

arguments.name: NO3SIGMACHECK
arguments.description: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of ODS output.

arguments.name: OUTLIMITS=
arguments.description: Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

arguments.name: OUTTABLE=
arguments.description: Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

arguments.name: SIGMAS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

arguments.name: SUBGROUPN=
arguments.description: Specifies a variable in the input data table whose values specify the subgroup sample sizes.

statements.name: IRCHART
statements.description: The IRCHART statement computes control charts for individual measurements and moving ranges.

arguments.name: EXCHART
arguments.description: Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= option are positive.

arguments.name: NMVGRANGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of consecutive subgroup summary statistics from which moving ranges are computed. Moving ranges are used to compute the estimate of the process standard deviation by the IRCHART statement, and by the XRCHART and XSCHART statements when you specify SMETHOD=MVGRANGE.

arguments.name: NO3SIGMACHECK
arguments.description: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.

arguments.description: Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= option are positive.

arguments.name: LIMITN=
arguments.description: Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits.

arguments.name: NO3SIGMACHECK
arguments.description: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of ODS output.

arguments.name: OUTLIMITS=
arguments.description: Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

arguments.name: OUTTABLE=
arguments.description: Creates an output SAS data table that saves the information plotted on the chart, including the subgroup variable values and their corresponding summary statistics and control limits.

arguments.name: SIGMAS=
arguments.description: Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

arguments.name: SMETHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.
arguments.help: SMETHOD=MAD | MMR | MVGRANGE | RMSDF | RMVLUE | RNOWEIGHT | SMVLUE | SNOWEIGHT

arguments.name: MAD
arguments.description: Calculates a median absolute deviation estimate for σ.

arguments.name: MMR
arguments.description: Calculates a median moving range estimate for σ.

arguments.name: MVGRANGE
arguments.description: Estimates σ based on a moving range of subgroup means.

arguments.name: RMSDF
arguments.description: Calculates a root-mean square estimate for σ.

arguments.name: RMVLUE
arguments.description: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup ranges.

arguments.name: RNOWEIGHT
arguments.description: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup ranges.

arguments.name: SMVLUE
arguments.description: Calculates a minimum variance linear unbiased estimate for σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: SNOWEIGHT
arguments.description: Estimates σ as an unweighted average of unbiased subgroup estimates of σ based on subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: TEST2RUN=
arguments.description: TEST2RUN=run-length
7 in a row
8 in a row
9 in a row
At least 10 out of 11 in a row
At least 12 out of 14 in a row
At least 16 out of 20 in a row

arguments.name: TEST3RUN=
arguments.description: Specifies the length of the pattern for Test 3 requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options.
Length of the pattern is at least 6.
Length of the pattern is at least 7.
Length of the pattern is at least 8.

arguments.name: TESTNSTD
arguments.description: applies the tests for special causes requested with the TESTS= and TESTS2= options to standardized test statistics when the subgroup sample sizes are not constant.

arguments.name: TESTOVERLAP
arguments.description: Applies tests for special causes (requested with the TESTS= or TESTS2= option) to overlapping patterns of points.

arguments.name: TESTS2=
arguments.description: Requests one or more tests for special causes for an R chart or s chart.
One point beyond Zone A (outside the control limits)
Nine points in a row in Zone C or beyond on one side of the central line
Six points in a row steadily increasing
Fourteen points in a row alternating up and down
Two out of three points in a row in Zone A or beyond
Four out of five points in a row in Zone B or beyond
Fifteen points in a row in Zone C on either or both sides of the central line
Eight points in a row on either or both sides of the central line with no points in Zone C

statements.name: SCHART
statements.description: The SCHART statement computes control charts for subgroup standard deviations.

arguments.name: ALLN
arguments.description: Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in the LIMITS= data table. statements.name: UCHART
statements.description: The UCHART statement computes control charts for the numbers of nonconformities per inspection unit in subgroup samples.

arguments.name: ALLN
arguments.description: Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in the LIMITS= data table. statements.name: XRCHART
statements.description: The XRCHART statement computes control charts for subgroup means and ranges.

arguments.name: ALLN
arguments.description: Includes all subgroups in the analysis, regardless of whether the subgroup sample size equals the nominal control limit sample size n specified by the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_ in the LIMITS= data table. Use the ALLN option in conjunction with the LIMITN= option or the variable _LIMITN_.

arguments.name: EXCHART
arguments.description: Includes a control chart in the results only when exceptions occur, specifically, when the control limits are exceeded or when any of the tests requested with the TESTS= option or the TESTS2= option are positive.

arguments.name: LIMITN=
arguments.description: Specifies a nominal sample size for the control limits.

arguments.name: NMVGRANGE=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of consecutive subgroup summary statistics from which moving ranges are computed. Moving ranges are used to compute the estimate of the process standard deviation by the IRCHART statement, and by the XRCHART and XSCHART statements when you specify SMETHOD=MVGRANGE.

arguments.name: NO3SIGMACHECK
arguments.description: Suppresses the check for 3σ limits when tests for special causes are requested.

arguments.name: NOPRINT
arguments.description: Suppresses the display of ODS output.

arguments.name: OUTLIMITS=
arguments.description: Creates an output data table that saves the control limits.

arguments.description: Specifies the width of the control limits in terms of the multiple k of the standard error of the subgroup summary statistic plotted on the chart. The value of k must be positive. By default, k=3.

arguments.description: Specifies a method for estimating the process standard deviation, σ.
